query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Quel sol che pria d’amor mi scaldò ’l petto, 2 di bella verità m’avea scoverto, 3 provando e riprovando, il dolce aspetto;
query.error: **English:** 1 That sun which formerly warmed my breast with love, 2 had revealed to me, by means of beautiful truth, 3 through testing and re-testing, its sweet aspect;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e io, per confessar corretto e certo 5 me stesso, tanto quanto si convenne 6 leva’ il capo a proferer più erto;
query.error: **English:** 4 and I, in order to confess correctly and certainly 5 myself, as much as was fitting, 6 raised my head to speak more boldly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 ma visïone apparve che ritenne 8 a sé me tanto stretto, per vedersi, 9 che di mia confession non mi sovvenne.
query.error: **English:** 7 but a vision appeared which held me 8 so tightly to itself, in order to be seen, 9 that I did not remember my confession.
query.result: 7 ac ða gesyhð ðe ðær æteowde me heold 8 to ðam swiðe fæste, ðurh ðæt heo wolde beon gesewen, 9 ðæt ic ða minre andetnysse ne gemunde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Quali per vetri trasparenti e tersi, 11 o ver per acque nitide e tranquille, 12 non sì profonde che i fondi sien persi,
query.error: **English:** 10 As through transparent and clear glass, 11 or through clear and tranquil waters, 12 not so deep that the bottoms are lost sight of,
query.result: 10 Swa ðurh glæs hluttor and scir, 11 oððe ðurh wæteru beorhte and stiðe, 12 na swa deope ðætte ða grundas sien forlorene,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 tornan d’i nostri visi le postille 14 debili sì, che perla in bianca fronte 15 non vien men forte a le nostre pupille;
query.error: **English:** 13 the reflections of our faces return 14 so faintly that a pearl on a white forehead 15 does not come less strongly to our pupils;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 tali vid’ io più facce a parlar pronte; 17 per ch’io dentro a l’error contrario corsi 18 a quel ch’accese amor tra l’omo e ’l fonte.
query.error: **English:** 16 such I saw more faces ready to speak; 17 so that I fell into the opposite error 18 to that which kindled love between the man and the spring.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Sùbito sì com’ io di lor m’accorsi, 20 quelle stimando specchiati sembianti, 21 per veder di cui fosser, li occhi torsi;
query.error: **English:** 19 Suddenly, as soon as I noticed them, 20 thinking them to be reflected images, 21 I turned my eyes to see whose they were;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 e nulla vidi, e ritorsili avanti 23 dritti nel lume de la dolce guida, 24 che, sorridendo, ardea ne li occhi santi.
query.error: **English:** 22 and I saw nothing, and turned them back 23 straight to the light of my sweet guide, 24 who, smiling, burned in his holy eyes.
query.result: 22 and ic ne geseah naht, and ic ða eft gewende 23 rihte on ðæs leohtes leoman ðære swetan lārēowe, 24 ðe ða, smilende, byrnende wæs on ðam halgum eagum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 «Non ti maravigliar perch’ io sorrida», 26 mi disse, «appresso il tuo püeril coto, 27 poi sopra ’l vero ancor lo piè non fida,
query.error: **English:** 25 "Do not wonder why I smile," 26 he said to me, "at your childish thought, 27 since your foot is not yet firm on the true path,
query.result: 25 "Ne wundrige ðe ðeah ðe ic smilie," 26 cwæð he to me, "æfter ðinum cildlican ðance, 27 ðonne ðu ðone soðan weg gen getrymman ne mæge,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 ma te rivolve, come suole, a vòto: 29 vere sustanze son ciò che tu vedi, 30 qui rilegate per manco di voto.
query.error: **English:** 28 but turns you around, as it is wont to do, in vain: 29 these are real substances that you see, 30 confined here for lack of a vow.
query.result: 28 ac ðe bewendeð, swa he gewuna is, on idel: 29 soðe ðing sind ða ðe ðu gesihst, 30 her bewergene for unrihte hæse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Però parla con esse e odi e credi; 32 ché la verace luce che le appaga 33 da sé non lascia lor torcer li piedi».
query.error: **English:** 31 Therefore speak with them and listen and believe; 32 for the true light that satisfies them 33 does not let their feet stray from it».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 E io a l’ombra che parea più vaga 35 di ragionar, drizza’mi, e cominciai, 36 quasi com’ uom cui troppa voglia smaga:
query.error: **English:** 34 And I, to the shade that seemed most eager 35 to speak, directed myself, and began, 36 almost like a man overcome by excessive desire:
query.result: 34 And ic ða to ðam scinan sciman, ðe ðuhte ðæt he spræce, 35 me gewende, and ða wordum cwæð, 36 swilce ðone ðe unmæðe oferswið:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 «O ben creato spirito, che a’ rai 38 di vita etterna la dolcezza senti 39 che, non gustata, non s’intende mai,
query.error: **English:** 37 "O well-created spirit, who in the rays 38 of eternal life feel the sweetness 39 that, untasted, is never understood,
query.result: 37 "Eala ðu wel geworht gast, ðe on ðam leohte 38 ðæs ecan lifes ða swetnesse felast, 39 ðe, næfre onbyrged, næfre man ne oncnæw,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 grazïoso mi fia se mi contenti 41 del nome tuo e de la vostra sorte». 42 Ond’ ella, pronta e con occhi ridenti:
query.error: **English:** 40 it would be gracious of you to satisfy me 41 with your name and your fate." 42 And she, ready and with smiling eyes:
query.result: 40 hit me ðinceð ðæt ðu milde wäre, gif ðu me sægdast 41 ðinne naman and ðinne gecynd." 42 Ond heo, gearo and mid hlihhende eagum:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 «La nostra carità non serra porte 44 a giusta voglia, se non come quella 45 che vuol simile a sé tutta sua corte.
query.error: **English:** 43 "Our charity does not close the door 44 to a just desire, except as that 45 which wants its whole court to be like itself.
query.result: 43 "Ure mildheortnes ne belucð duru 44 rihtwisre wilnunge, buton swa swa ðæt 45 ðe wile ðæt eal hire hired swa sie."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 I’ fui nel mondo vergine sorella; 47 e se la mente tua ben sé riguarda, 48 non mi ti celerà l’esser più bella,
query.error: **English:** 46 I was in the world a virgin sister; 47 and if your mind looks at itself well, 48 it will not hide from you that I am more beautiful,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 ma riconoscerai ch’i’ son Piccarda, 50 che, posta qui con questi altri beati, 51 beata sono in la spera più tarda.
query.error: **English:** 49 but you will recognize that I am Piccarda, 50 who, placed here with these other blessed ones, 51 am blessed in the slowest sphere.
query.result: 49 ac ðu oncnawest ðæt ic eom Piccarda, 50 ðe, aset hēr mid ðissum ōðrum gesælgum, 51 eom gesælig on ðære læstan sfēran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Li nostri affetti, che solo infiammati 53 son nel piacer de lo Spirito Santo, 54 letizian del suo ordine formati.
query.error: **English:** 52 Our affections, which are kindled only 53 by the pleasure of the Holy Spirit, 54 rejoice in the order that He has formed.
query.result: 52 Ure lufu, ðe beoð anlip ðurh ðone Halgan Gast, 53 ðurh ðæs Halgan Gastes willan, 54 ðurh ðæs Halgan Gastes sibbe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 E questa sorte che par giù cotanto, 56 però n’è data, perché fuor negletti 57 li nostri voti, e vòti in alcun canto».
query.error: **English:** 55 And this lot which seems so hard down there, 56 is given to us because our vows were neglected, 57 and our vows were empty in some way.
query.result: 55 And ðeos wyrd ðe ðynceð swa heard niðer, 56 ðurh ðæt us is forgolden, forðæmðe forgietene wæron 57 ure gehatu, and gehatu idel wæron on sumum dæle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Ond’ io a lei: «Ne’ mirabili aspetti 59 vostri risplende non so che divino 60 che vi trasmuta da’ primi concetti:
query.error: **English:** 58 And I to her: "Your wondrous aspects 59 shine with something divine that I cannot name, 60 which transforms you from your original concepts:
query.result: 58 And ic to hire: "Ne ða wundorlican andwlitu 59 eower scinap ne ic nat hwilc godcundlic 60 ðe eow awent fram ðam forman ðancum:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 però non fui a rimembrar festino; 62 ma or m’aiuta ciò che tu mi dici, 63 sì che raffigurar m’è più latino.
query.error: **English:** 61 therefore I was slow to remember; 62 but now what you tell me helps me, 63 so that it is easier for me to picture you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Ma dimmi: voi che siete qui felici, 65 disiderate voi più alto loco 66 per più vedere e per più farvi amici?».
query.error: **English:** 64 But tell me, you who are happy here, 65 do you desire a higher place 66 to see more and to make more friends?
query.result: 64 Ac secg ðu me, ðe her on sælum sind, 65 wilniað ge wilnunga mare 66 ðurh ðone maððum and ðurh ða miclan mærða?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Con quelle altr’ ombre pria sorrise un poco; 68 da indi mi rispuose tanto lieta, 69 ch’arder parea d’amor nel primo foco:
query.error: **English:** 67 With those other shades he smiled a little first; 68 then he answered me so joyfully 69 that he seemed to burn with love in the first fire:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 «Frate, la nostra volontà quïeta 71 virtù di carità, che fa volerne 72 sol quel ch’avemo, e d’altro non ci asseta.
query.error: **English:** 70 "Brother, our will is quieted 71 by the power of charity, which makes us desire 72 only what we have, and nothing else satisfies us.
query.result: 70 "Broðor, ure willa is gestilled 71 ðurh ðære lufe mihte, ðe ðæt gewilnað 72 ðæt ðæt we hafað, and elles noht ne gyrneð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Se disïassimo esser più superne, 74 foran discordi li nostri disiri 75 dal voler di colui che qui ne cerne;
query.error: **English:** 73 If we were to say that they are more sublime, 74 our desires would be discordant 75 from the will of Him who assigns us here;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 che vedrai non capere in questi giri, 77 s’essere in carità è qui necesse, 78 e se la sua natura ben rimiri.
query.error: **English:** 76 for you will see that it is not possible in these circles, 77 if being in charity is necessary here, 78 and if you consider its nature well.
query.result: 76 ðæt ðu gesyhst ðæt nis on ðissum hringum, 77 gif beon on sibbe is her neod, 78 and gif ðu hire gecynd geriht locast.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Anzi è formale ad esto beato esse 80 tenersi dentro a la divina voglia, 81 per ch’una fansi nostre voglie stesse;
query.error: **English:** 79 Rather, it is essential to this blessed existence 80 to keep oneself within the divine will, 81 so that our own desires become one with it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 sì che, come noi sem di soglia in soglia 83 per questo regno, a tutto il regno piace 84 com’ a lo re che ’n suo voler ne ’nvoglia.
query.error: **English:** 82 so that, as we pass from threshold to threshold 83 through this kingdom, we please the entire kingdom, 84 just as we please the king who kindles in us his desire.
query.result: 82 swa ðæt, swa we synd of ðyrsce in ðyrsc 83 ðurh ðis rice, eallum ðam rice licað 84 swa swa ðam cyninge ðe on his willan us onwæcð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 E ’n la sua volontade è nostra pace: 86 ell’ è quel mare al qual tutto si move 87 ciò ch’ella crïa o che natura face».
query.error: **English:** 85 And in His will is our peace: 86 He is that sea to which all things move 87 that she creates or that nature makes.
query.result: 85 And on His will is our peace: 86 He is that sea to which all things move 87 that she creates or that nature makes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Chiaro mi fu allor come ogne dove 89 in cielo è paradiso, etsi la grazia 90 del sommo ben d’un modo non vi piove.
query.error: **English:** 88 It was clear to me then, as fire is clear, 89 that Paradise is in heaven, and that grace 90 of the highest good does not rain down there in one way.
query.result: 88 Me wæs ða swipe open on mode 89 ðæt ðæt is heofona rice, and ðæt ðære 90 ðæs selestan gesælda ne bið æghwær gelic.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Ma sì com’ elli avvien, s’un cibo sazia 92 e d’un altro rimane ancor la gola, 93 che quel si chere e di quel si ringrazia,
query.error: **English:** 91 But just as it happens, if one food sates 92 and the appetite still remains for another, 93 so that one is desired and the other is thanked for,
query.result: 91 Ac swá swá hit gelimpð, gif án mete gefyllo 92 and of óðrum giet ðá gít gíerna, 93 ðæt ðone man wyrðð and ðone man ðancað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 così fec’ io con atto e con parola, 95 per apprender da lei qual fu la tela 96 onde non trasse infino a co la spuola.
query.error: **English:** 94 so I did with gesture and with words, 95 to learn from her what was the web 96 that she did not draw the shuttle through to the end.
query.result: 94 swá dyde ic mid ðære gesceaft and mid ðám wordum, 95 ðæt ic wolde leornian æt hýre hwæt ðæt web wære 96 ðe héo ðone spólan ne ðurhdráf oð ende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 «Perfetta vita e alto merto inciela 98 donna più sù», mi disse, «a la cui norma 99 nel vostro mondo giù si veste e vela,
query.error: **English:** 97 "A perfect life and high merit in heaven 98 a lady higher up," she said to me, "according to whose rule 99 down in your world one dresses and veils oneself,
query.result: 97 "Fulfremed lif and heah geðincð on heofonum 98 wif fægerre ofer," cwæð heo me, "ðære ðinum geweald 99 on eowrum life hwilum wrixl and wrixlð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 perché fino al morir si vegghi e dorma 101 con quello sposo ch’ogne voto accetta 102 che caritate a suo piacer conforma.
query.error: **English:** 100 so that until death one watches and sleeps 101 with that Bridegroom who accepts every vow 102 that charity conforms to his pleasure.
query.result: 100 ðæt ðu oð deað dæg wunige and slape 101 mid ðam brydguman ðe ælc gehat ðigð 102 ðe siblufu æfter his willan geðafað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Dal mondo, per seguirla, giovinetta 104 fuggi’mi, e nel suo abito mi chiusi 105 e promisi la via de la sua setta.
query.error: **English:** 103 From the world, to follow her, as a young girl 104 she fled from me, and in her habit I cloaked myself 105 and promised the way of her sect.
query.result: 103 Of ðisse worulde, hire ðæs folgiande, geong 104 heo ða fram me fleah, and on hire reaf me beloc, 105 and ðære sibbe weg geheht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Uomini poi, a mal più ch’a bene usi, 107 fuor mi rapiron de la dolce chiostra: 108 Iddio si sa qual poi mia vita fusi.
query.error: **English:** 106 Men then, accustomed more to evil than to good, 107 dragged me away from the sweet cloister: 108 God knows what my life was like afterwards.
query.result: 106 Weras ða, mare to yfele ðonne to gode, 107 me fram ðære swetan gesomnunge aræfdon: 108 God ana wat hwilc min lif wæs ða æfter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 E quest’ altro splendor che ti si mostra 110 da la mia destra parte e che s’accende 111 di tutto il lume de la spera nostra,
query.error: **English:** 109 And this other splendor that shows itself to you 110 on my right side and that is kindled 111 by all the light of our sphere,
query.result: 109 And ðeos oðer beorhtoð ðe ðe sylfum scyneð 110 fram ðære swiðran healfe ðinre, and ðe byrnende 111 of ealre ðære leohte ðære lyfte ure,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 ciò ch’io dico di me, di sé intende; 113 sorella fu, e così le fu tolta 114 di capo l’ombra de le sacre bende.
query.error: **English:** 112 what I say of myself, she intends of herself; 113 she was my sister, and thus was taken from her 114 the veil of the sacred bands from her head.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ma poi che pur al mondo fu rivolta 116 contra suo grado e contra buona usanza, 117 non fu dal vel del cor già mai disciolta.
query.error: **English:** 115 But after she was turned back to the world 116 against her will and against good custom, 117 she was never freed from the veil of her heart.
query.result: 115 Ac ða ðe heo ðeah ðæs weorolde onwænd 116 ongean hyre willan and ongean ða wisan, 117 heo næfre ðæs wæs of ðæs heortan hrægle alysð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Quest’ è la luce de la gran Costanza 119 che del secondo vento di Soave 120 generò ’l terzo e l’ultima possanza».
query.error: **English:** 118 This is the light of the great Constance 119 who from the second wind of Swabia 120 brought forth the third and final power.
query.result: 118 Þis is ðæs miclan Costanties leoht 119 ðe ðæs æfteran windes of Swæfe 120 ðone ðriddan and ðone ytemestan miht gebigde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Così parlommi, e poi cominciò ‘Ave, 122 Maria’ cantando, e cantando vanio 123 come per acqua cupa cosa grave.
query.error: **English:** 121 Thus she spoke to me, and then began to sing ‘Ave, 122 Maria’, and singing she vanished 123 like a heavy object through deep water.
query.result: 121 Þus heo cwæð to me, and ða ongann ‘Ave, 122 Maria’ singan, and singende gewat 123 swa swa ðurh deope wæter ðing swære.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 La vista mia, che tanto lei seguio 125 quanto possibil fu, poi che la perse, 126 volsesi al segno di maggior disio,
query.error: **English:** 124 My sight, which followed her as much 125 as was possible, after it lost her, 126 turned to the sign of greatest desire,
query.result: 124 Min gesihð, ðe hire folgode swa fela 125 swa hit mihte ða ðe hit ða forleas, 126 hit wende to ðam tacne ðæs mæstan wilnunge,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 e ciò mi fece a dimandar più tardo.
query.error: **English:** 130 and that made me slower to ask.
query.result: 130 and ðæt me worhte slawran to acsianne.
